

Collateral 	Definition
Type I (Standard)	Approved by Development Authority & Plan available 
Type II	Not approved by Development Authority & Plan available + Non-Agricultural (NA) Conversion
Type III	Not approved by Development Authority & Plan not available + Non-Agricultural (NA)  Conversion
Type IV	Not approved by Development Authority & Plan not available + Non-Agricultural (NA)  Conversion not available or any major technical deviation in property
Special Collateral	Special collaterals

Collateral Type	Indicative list of properties funded
Type I	Authority approved properties with plans
Type II	Gram Panchayat & Zilla Parishad Properties, 
B-Khatta properties, Gunthewari properties upto 2008, Society Patta upto G+3 floors
Type III	Gaothan properties, Multi dwelling units, Regularized colonies, Lal Dora, Outside MC limits new properties, Properties with vertical/horizontal deviations
Type IV	Khasra properties, Notarised ownership properties, Single title deed properties, Properties with narrow approach roads, GP Patta properties

Collateral Type	Central	East	North	South	West
Type I	3	6	11	3	5
Type II	7	6	21	27	16
Type III	5	9	36	19	14
Type IV	6	9	33	16	14
Special Collateral	 	 	 	3	 
Total	21	30	101	69	49

Sanction Building plan<br>2\. NA Order/ Diversion<br>3\. Tax Receipt<br>4\. Sale Deed<br>5\. Prakosth in case of Multistorey buildings 2    |Central  |Chattisgarh       |Chattisgarh                                               |Bungalow Properties In Municipal Limits                                                                                                                                            |Non TNCP And Sanction Plan Available                                                                                                                   |Type II           |1\. Diversion Order Must Be Available For Residential Usage In Newely Devloped Colonies.<br>2\. Builder Layout Map With Plot Numbering Should Be Available Seal & Signed By Builder And Purchaser And To Be Part Of Sale Deed<br>3\. In Old Developed Colony, Route Map Signed By Builder/ Seller And Purchaser To Be Part Of Sale Deed For Identification.<br>4\. Colony Should Have Minimum Development Of 50% And Development Work Must Be Running. Proper Approach Road/ACCess Till Property Should Be Available.<br>5\. Incomplete Developed Colonies From Long Time Where No Construction Activity Is Observed Would Not Be Considered.<br>6\. Nearby Habitation Should Be More Than 50% Within 500 Mtr Radius.<br>7\. Other Insitutions Funding Proofs Should Be Available. 3    |Central  |Chattisgarh       |Chattisgarh                                               |Bungalow Properties In Gram Panchayat Limits                                                                                                                                       |Non TNCP And Sanction Plan Available                                                                                                                   |Type II           |1\. Diversion Order Must Be Available For Residential Usage.<br>2\. Builder Layout Map With Plot Numbering Should Be Available Seal & Signed By Builder And Purchaser And To Be Part Of Sale Deed<br>3\. In Old Developed Colony, Route Map Signed By Builder/ Seller And Purchaser To Be Part Of Sale Deed For Identification.<br>4\. Colony Should Have Minimum Development Of 50% And Development Work Must Be Running. Proper Approach Road/ACCess Till Property Should Be Available.<br>5\. Incomplete Developed Colonies From Long Time Where No Construction Activity Is Observed Would Not Be Considered.<br>6\. Nearby Habitation Should Be More Than 50% Within 500 Mtr Radius. 7. Other Insitutions Funding Proofs Should Be Available. We Will Not Be 1St Instituion To Fund In Such Colonies. 4    |Central  |Chattisgarh       |Chattisgarh                                               |Bungalow Properties                                                                                                                                                                |Non TNCP And Non Sanction Plan In P+C                                                                                                                  |Type III          |1\. Property Must Be Identifiable<br>2\. Properties Located On Main Roads Will Not Be Considered Where Demolition Risk Is Higher.<br>3\. Architect Floor Plans And Estimate Should Be Available In Construction Cases<br>4\. Funding To Be Done In Colonies With Basic Development<br>5\. Minimum Plinth Stage Required Before Disbursement For Construction Cases.<br>6\. Maximum G2 Built Up Will Be Considered.<br>7\. In Gram Panchayat Limits Land Should Be Diverted. 8. In Municipal Area Property Not In Negative/ UNApproved Area<br>9\. Document Required- Ownership DOCument , Arch. Floor Map And Estimate<br>10\. Minimum 10 Ft Road Width In Front Of Property Rm To Be Done<br>10\. DOCument Required- Ownership DOCument , NAzri NAksha For Identification.<br>11\. Minimum 10 Ft Road Width In Front Of Property NA Order From Competant Authority,<br>2\. Property Must Be Identifiable.<br>5\. Properties With Demolition Risk Is To Be Avoided.<br>6\. Funding To Be Done In Locations With Basic Necessities Like Roads, Water Supply And Electricity.<br>7\. Approach To The Property Shall Be Clear With Minimum Width Of Road 10 Feet Wide.<br>8\. Under Construction Property With Minimum Stage Of Construction Above Plinth Level To Be Funded With Deemed Apf Or Apf Process 21   |West     |MMR               |MMR                                                       |Gramp Panchayat Property (Multi Dwelling Residential Unit)                                                                                                                         |Multi Dwelling Units- Till G/S  + 3 Floors                                                                                                             |Type II           |1.Gram Panchayat Plan, Cc & Oc Wherever Applicable,  Section 44 NA Order/Collector Approved ,<br>2\.                                                                         |MDU, FLOORS and ROW HOUSE                                                                                                                              |Type II           |1.)Route plan from nearest landmark is to be documented duly signed by seller/Buyer.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                2.)EC Bill Should be in favour of present owner and Meter number as per site and as per EC bill should be same.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  3.)Self-Declaration/Indemnity on stamp paper duly signed by seller and buyer for acceptance of property along with photograph of applicant standing in front of property                                                                                                                       4.)Architect Floor/Elevation plan duly signed by seller/buyer is to be documented                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      5.)Minumum Plot area is 100 Sqyard   for MDU.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      6.)Minimum distance from religous structure is 50metres                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           7.)Maximum Five units Per floor are applicable for MDU                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   8.)Noting to be done on mother deed for HL/Resale trasaction.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               <br>9.)Colony has to be under the list of Regularized colony which were Regularized between 1978 to 1982.<br>10)Search of 13 years is possible, which implies that atleast one registered title document has to be executed for the captioned plot prior to the year 2011.<br>11.)Road access to the property must not be less than 10 feet. Mother deed endorsement necessary plus registered sale deed in favour of our customer necessary- For Equitable mortgage to be done. EM documents- Declaration cum MOE needed.<br>2\. If endorsement is not possible as aforesaid in case of resale cases, then partial RM mandatory along with EM documents i.e. declaration cum MOE<br>3\. GDA NOC is not available since the construction layout is not as per GDA rules, hence, possibility is that GDA may declare the construction as illegal and may levy penalty or demolish the structure. SARFAESI enforcement is possible, provided regd sale deed is there in favour of our customer and title is clear and the construction is not demolished or declared illegal by GDA through any circular/ notification before sale certificate is registered by ABHFL under SARFAESI.<br>4\. In HL cases, indemnity from seller required. In case of builder purchase case, where seller is a builder and allottee, then indemnity from them is needed.<br>5\. GDA identified / restricted areas and units not to be funded. Mutation entry should be there in the name of the customer.<br>7\. Partial RM with EM documents- Declaration cum MOE necessary in properties with lal dora certificate.<br>2\. Lal dora certificate to be obtained for properties in lal dora village.<br>3\. Undertaking from property owner as attested by sarpanch and namberdar is to be obtained.<br>4\. SARFAESI enforcement is possible only if the property is not repossessed by the govt authorities.<br>5\. Regd Title documents for last 13 years necessary;<br>6\. Regd sale deed in favour of customer necessary<br>7\. Latest Tax receipt and Electricity bill (if available) to be collected, which should be in the name of seller/buyer depending upon the transaction<br>8\. There should not be any outstanding in Tax payment and Electricity. Undertaking from property owner as attested by sarpanch and namberdar is to be obtained.<br>4\. 262  |North    |Delhi-NCR         |Delhi                                                     |Without Perfect Title (With Notary & Registered GPA)                                                                                                                               |Without Perfect Title (With Notary & Registered GPA)                                                                                                   |Type IV           |1\. GPA/ATS/Will should have been executed with full consideration and absolute power to sell the property and receive consideration amount from the buyer should be mentioned in these all previous chain title documents for last 13 years.<br>2\. Possession proofs- Electricity Bill to be taken in the name of all the owners for last 13 years.<br>3\. Origination of title flow to be determined basis Khatauni in the name of the current seller / initial owner as per title flow. In case mutation entry is not available in favour of seller in HL cases, public notice of 15 days with no claim certificate necessary before cheque handover and mutation to be done in favour of our customer / buyer as PDD.<br>4\. Registered sale deed in favour of our customer;<br>5\. Transaction to be done basis copy of the disbursement cheque and original cheque to be handover or funds to be disbursed only after clear search report in SRO office is obtained by the vendor, after the sale deed is registered;<br>6\. Indemnity in ABHFL std format to be taken from seller and buyer; <br>7\. In case entire property along with land is not getting mortgaged i.e. only floor or flat is being mortgaged, then RM is mandatory;<br>8\. In case entire property along with land is getting mortgaged then EM is fine. <br>9\. Since possession of 13 years is the key factor to fund these properties, technical team to verify peaceful and uninterrupted possession by owners in last 13 years.<br>10\. Latest Tax receipt and Electricity bill (if available) to be collected, which should be in the name of seller/buyer depending upon the transaction<br>11\. There should not be any outstanding in Tax payment and Electricity.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                       
263  |North    |Delhi-NCR         |Delhi                                                     |Without Perfect Title (With Notary & Registered GPA)                                                                                                                               |Without Perfect Title (With Notary & Registered GPA)                                                                                                   |Type IV           |1\. GPA/ATS/Will should have been executed with full consideration and absolute power to sell the property and receive consideration amount from the buyer should be mentioned in these all previous chain title documents for last 13 years.<br>2\. Possession proofs- Electricity Bill to be taken in the name of all the owners for last 13 years.<br>3.Origination of title flow to be determined basis Khatauni in the name of the current seller / initial owner as per title flow. In case mutation entry is not available in favour of seller in HL cases, public notice of 15 days with no claim certificate necessary before cheque handover and mutation to be done in favour of our customer / buyer as PDD.<br>4\. Registered gift deed to be done in favour of the customer, basis the latest GPA to abide by Supreme court order.<br>5\. Original cheque to be handover or funds to be disbursed only after clear search report in SRO office is obtained by the vendor, and after the registration of gift deed<br>6\. GPA holder (if alive) and owner as per the Gift Deed to be taken on loan structure.<br>7\. RM is mandatory to be signed by GPA holder (if alive) and owner as per the Gift Deed<br>8\. Since possession of 13 years is the key factor to fund these properties, technical team to verify peaceful and uninterrupted possession by owners in last 13 years.<br>9\. Latest Tax receipt and Electricity bill (if available) to be collected, which should be in the name of seller/buyer depending upon the transaction<br>10\. There should not be any outstanding in Tax payment and Electricity.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

266  |North    |RAJASTHAN         |RAJASTHAN                                                 |Agricultural Property                                                                                                                                                              |Agricultural Property                                                                                                                                  |Type IV           |1\. Vendor to opine if the property can be enforced under SARFAESI<br>2\. CERSAI filing is permitted for such properties and necessary forms are filled, before disbursement<br>3\. Indemnity from the seller and buyer to be taken with respect to the penalties as aforesaid<br>4\. RM is mandatory for specifying the accurate property description with actual boundaries.                                                   <br>5\. Technical team to confirm the property demarcation basis site visit. <br>6\. Property should be well identified.<br>7\. Min habitation will be 30%.<br>8\. Proper approach road of at least 10 ft will be available.<br>9\. RM/Gift deed mentioning property use as Residential/Aawasiya.<br>10\. Utility bill is must in already constructed properties.<br>11\. LTV will be 50%. Note-No P+C allowed.<br>12\. Latest Tax receipt and Electricity bill (if available) to be collected, which should be in the name of seller/buyer depending upon the transaction<br>13\.
